reference_no_or_id: I.T.A. No. 845/IB of 2011, ITA No. 1210/LB/06 (Assessment Year 2004)

accussed_details.name: Mrs. Naheeda Begum Awan
accussed_details.designation: Member of M/s Haseeb Estate and Builders

complaint_summary: The Department alleged suppressed receipts totaling Rs.168,154,163/- in the Taxpayer's bank accounts, invoking section 122(5) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001.
investigation_summary: The Taxpayer provided evidence and reconciliation statements correlating bank deposits with declared financial resources. The Department failed to establish a nexus between credit transactions and business receipts.
judgment_summary: The Appellate Tribunal upheld the decision of CIR(A), vacating the assessment order. The Tribunal found the Department's actions presumptive and lacking definite information, deeming the proceedings under section 122(5) void.
Decision_or_verdict: Departmental appeal dismissed; CIR(A)'s order upheld.
legal_arguments: Definite information required under section 122(5) was missing.
Fishing inquiries are impermissible under the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001.
Burden of proof lies on the tax officer to establish specific facts of transactions.

maxims.Burden of proof: Heavy burden lies upon the tax officer to establish specific facts of transactions.

legal_terms.Definite Information: Concrete evidence required to amend deemed assessments.
legal_terms.Fishing Inquiries: Impermissible investigative actions lacking specific allegations.

words_and_phrases.Suppressed Receipts: Undeclared income presumed from credit transactions.
words_and_phrases.Revolving Capital: Total circulating financial resources of the taxpayer.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the Department's presumptive taxation of Rs.168,154,163/- as suppressed receipts in the Taxpayer's bank accounts. The Appellate Tribunal found the Department's actions lacking definite information and upheld CIR(A)'s decision to vacate the assessment order. The judgment emphasizes the importance of concrete evidence and prohibits fishing inquiries under section 122(5) of the Income Tax Ordinance, 2001.
